message.content:
Neural Networks, Reinforcement Learning. 

Neural Networks: The paper discusses the use of a time-delay neural network (TDNN) architecture to improve the performance of job-shop scheduling. The TDNN is used to process irregular-length schedules and is shown to match the performance of a previous hand-engineered system.

Reinforcement Learning: The paper formulates the job-shop scheduling task for solution by the reinforcement learning algorithm T D(). The TD() algorithm is used to learn from experience and improve the quality of the resulting schedules. The paper shows that the TDNN-TD() network significantly outperforms the best previous (non-learning) solution to this problem in terms of the quality of the resulting schedules and the number of search steps required to construct them.
